bcbioSingleCell 0.2.1

Combine Multiple SingleCellExperiment Objects

Source: R/combine-methods.R
combine.Rd

Combine Multiple SingleCellExperiment Objects

# S4 method for SingleCellExperiment,SingleCellExperiment
combine(x, y, ...)

Arguments

x

One of the values.
y

A second value.
...

Any other objects of the same class as x and y.

Value

SingleCellExperiment.

Note

We're attempting to make this as strict as possible, requiring:

  • Rows (genes) across objects must be identical.

  • Organism and genome build must be identical.

  • rowRanges metadata must be identical.

  • colData (cellular barcode metrics) must contain the same columns.

  • sampleData must contain the same columns.

See also

help("merge.Matrix", "Matrix.utils").

Examples

# For this simple working example, let's duplicate our minimal dataset,
# modify the cell barcodes, and combine

x <- indrops_small
validObject(x)
#> [1] TRUE
sampleData(x)
#> DataFrame with 1 row and 8 columns
#>                      sampleName             fileName          description
#>                        <factor>             <factor>             <factor>
#> multiplexed_AAAAAAAA      rep_1 multiplexed.fastq.gz multiplexed-AAAAAAAA
#>                         index sequence aggregate  revcomp interestingGroups
#>                      <factor> <factor>  <factor> <factor>          <factor>
#> multiplexed_AAAAAAAA        1 TTTTTTTT    sample AAAAAAAA             rep_1
sampleNames(x)
#> multiplexed_AAAAAAAA 
#>              "rep_1" 

# Here we're faking a distinct replicate, just as an example
y <- indrops_small
# Modify the cellular barcodes prefix
colnames(y) <- gsub(
    pattern = "^multiplexed_AAAAAAAA",
    replacement = "multiplexed_CCCCCCCC",
    x = colnames(y)
)
# Modify the column data
colData(y)[["description"]] <- factor("multiplexed-CCCCCCCC")
colData(y)[["sampleID"]] <- factor("multiplexed_CCCCCCCC")
colData(y)[["sampleName"]] <- factor("rep_2")
colData(y)[["sequence"]] <- factor("GGGGGGGG")
colData(y)[["revcomp"]] <- factor("CCCCCCCC")
# Modify the sample data
sampleData(y)[["sampleName"]] <- factor("rep_2")
sampleData(y)[["description"]] <- factor("multiplexed-CCCCCCCC")
sampleData(y)[["sequence"]] <- factor("GGGGGGGG")
sampleData(y)[["revcomp"]] <- factor("CCCCCCCC")
rownames(sampleData(y)) <- "multiplexed_CCCCCCCC"
validObject(y)
#> [1] TRUE
sampleData(y)
#> DataFrame with 1 row and 8 columns
#>                      sampleName             fileName          description
#>                        <factor>             <factor>             <factor>
#> multiplexed_CCCCCCCC      rep_2 multiplexed.fastq.gz multiplexed-CCCCCCCC
#>                         index sequence aggregate  revcomp interestingGroups
#>                      <factor> <factor>  <factor> <factor>          <factor>
#> multiplexed_CCCCCCCC        1 GGGGGGGG    sample CCCCCCCC             rep_2
sampleNames(y)
#> multiplexed_CCCCCCCC 
#>              "rep_2" 

# Combine two SingleCellExperiment objects
c <- combine(x, y)
print(c)
#> class: SingleCellExperiment 
#> dim: 500 1000 
#> metadata(12): interestingGroups organism ... utilsSessionInfo
#>   devtoolsSessionInfo
#> assays(1): counts
#> rownames(500): ENSG00000000457 ENSG00000002586 ... ENSG00000283060
#>   ENSG00000283391
#> rowData names(7): broadClass description ... geneName seqCoordSystem
#> colnames(1000): multiplexed_AAAAAAAA_AAACACTA_ATCCCACG
#>   multiplexed_AAAAAAAA_AAACACTA_CTTAGGTA ...
#>   multiplexed_CCCCCCCC_TGTTATCA_ACGCAGAG
#>   multiplexed_CCCCCCCC_TGTTATCA_CAAGTCAT
#> colData names(15): nCount sampleID ... aggregate revcomp
#> reducedDimNames(0):
#> spikeNames(0):
sampleNames(c)
#> multiplexed_AAAAAAAA multiplexed_CCCCCCCC 
#>              "rep_1"              "rep_2"
